column4: why is it so difficult (impossible) to rename an NTFS usb flash drive in ubuntu?
why can't i rename a flash drive in nautilus? It lets me select rename and type a new name but then gives me an error?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RenameUSBDrive (works for partitions as well)
I'm there and tried that, didn't work at all
worked for renaming my windows hdd but not my usb flash drives
were they mounted?
hm, I just used the vfat today on my usb stick, don't have an ntfs one
doh! dammit i forgot it's FAT32, let me try that
actually it doesn't say anything about vfat in that webpage, which command do I use in terminal... vfat or mlabel...I tried mlabel...didn't work
vfat, it works on fat32
ok i'll read up on it
I cannot find information in the ubuntu forums about using vfat to rename usb volumes, what is the syntax?
that page I gave you tells you exactly how to use mtools to do the job
ok i'm confuse, I told you i used mtools and it didn't work and you said to use vfat
did you get some error about mtools_skip_check?
yes
then errors about it not being mounted when it was and vice versa
echo mtools_skip_check=1 >> ~/.mtoolsrc , and try again
ok lemme try that, brb
thank you sir, working fine now
no problem. But I am going to point out that the error message said exactly what to do ;)
doh, guess I need to read fine print
sometimes the error messages are more obscure than religious texts, and sometimes they tell you what to do. We were lucky today ;)
